definition: A condition characterized by difficulty in breathing, often accompanied by a feeling of suffocation or tightness in the chest. It is commonly used to describe a medical emergency or a symptom of a respiratory or cardiac disorder.

examples.german: Bei körperlicher Anstrengung bekomme ich Atemnot.
examples.english: I get shortness of breath during physical exertion.

examples.german: Atemnot kann ein Symptom für verschiedene Krankheiten sein.
examples.english: Shortness of breath can be a symptom of various diseases.

examples.german: Die Patientin klagte über Atemnot und Schwindelgefühl.
examples.english: The patient complained of shortness of breath and dizziness.

examples.german: Atemnot kann auch psychische Ursachen haben.
examples.english: Shortness of breath can also have psychological causes.

examples.german: Der Arzt diagnostizierte bei dem Patienten Atemnot.
examples.english: The doctor diagnosed the patient with shortness of breath.
